articles.title: Kim Jong Il Meets with Russian Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Meets with Russian Delegation
						
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il met with the visiting delegation of the External Intelligence Bureau of the Russian Federation led by its Director M. Y. Fradkov on Tuesday.
					 On hand were U Tong Chuk, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 The head of the delegation presented Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, with the gifts he prepared with sincerity.
					
					 Kim Jong Il thanked for this and had a talk with the delegation and its party in a cordial and friendly atmosphere.
					
					 After receiving them, he hosted a dinner in honor of the guests.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the delegation and its party and official diplomats of the Russian embassy in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there were U Tong Chuk and Kim Kye Gwan.
					
					 The dinner took place in an amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party and State Leaders 
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent messages to heads of party and state of different countries in reply to their messages on the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The replies went to Michel Suleiman, president of Lebanon, Bashar Al-Assad, regional secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party and president of Syria, Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, Asif Ali Zardari, president of Pakistan, Mwai Kibaki, president of Kenya, Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo, and Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda.
					
					 He also sent a reply message to Syed Yousaf Raza Gillani, prime minister of Pakistan.
					
					 In the replies he expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and those countries would grow stronger in various fields and wished them successes in the work for peace, stability and prosperity of their countries.

articles.title: Messages to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Messages to Kim Jong Il from Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received messages from foreign countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The messages came from the C.C., the People's Party of Cambodia, the C.C., the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the general secretary of the C.C., the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the general secretary of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia, the general secretary of the C.C., the Bangladesh Communist Party, the secretary general of the Palestine Liberation Democratic Front, the chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party, the chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, the chairman and the general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the chairman and the first secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Norway, the chairman of the National Leadership of the Communist Party of Denmark (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, the chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the chairman of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, the honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, the chairman of the Communist Party of Sweden, the general secretary of the C.C., the Czechoslovak Communist Party, the chairman of the C.C., the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia, the general secretary of the C.C., the French Revolutionary Communist League, the chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland For the Peace and Socialism, the chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Polish Communist Party, the general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party, the chairman and the vice-chairman who is concurrently international secretary and the general secretary of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the general secretary of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, the general secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo, the general secretary of the National Progressive Unionist Party of Egypt, the chairman of the C.C., the Socialist Party of Mexico, the national chairman and the international secretary of the C.C., the Brazilian Communist Party, the national president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, the national leader of the C.C., the Communist Party of Canada (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman, the general secretary and the international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland", the secretary of the National Executive Committee of the Socialist Party-Ample Front of Ecuador and others.
					
					 Kim Jong Il also received messages from high-ranking officials of political, social, military and economic circles of China, Russia, Nepal, Malaysia, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Syria, Cambodia, Kuwait, Thailand, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Turkey, Iran, Indonesia, India, Japan, Yemen, Vietnam, Norway, Denmark, Germany, Romania, Moldova, Bulgaria, Belarus, Switzerland, Sweden, the Czech Republic, France, Finland, Poland, Britain, Austria, Ukraine, Iceland, Italy, Guinea, Nigeria, South Africa, Mali, Benin, Democratic Congo, Tunisia, Uganda, Egypt, Ethiopia, Mexico, Brazil, Venezuela, Canada, Colombia, Peru, Uruguay, Ecuador and New Zealand and representatives of international organizations, Juche idea study organizations and organizations for supporting Korea's reunification and friendship.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visited Nearly 80 Units in 2-odd Years
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visited Nearly 80 Units in 2-odd Years 
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided the heyday of the development of light industry through the forced march of field guidance after kindling the torch of the new great revolutionary surge during his visit to the Chollima Steel Complex on December 24, Juche 97 (2008).
					 Since then he visited nearly 80 units, an average of at least two units a month, for development of light industry.
					
					 During his visits to the Pyongyang Flour-Processing Combine, Hoeryong Foodstuff Processing Factory and other factories and units he earnestly called for building modern factories as required by the new century so that people can benefit from them.
					
					 When he visited the Samilpho Special Products Factory he said that he saw a little fire for the development of light industry there, calling for making that fire flare up across the country.
					
					 When he went to Changsong County, where President Kim Il Sung ushered in the new history of golden mountain, he highly appreciated the achievements made by a small foodstuff factory in the mountainous area and made sure that a flame was kindled to effect a fresh turn in local industrial development, learning from the example set by the county.
					
					 Giving field guidance to a number of different units ranging from key light industrial factories to small local production cooperatives, he saw to it that the hot wind of light industrial development swept across the country.
					
					 When he visited the workers of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex he reposed big trust in them, encouraging them to take the lead in the great surge for the improvement of the people's living standards. He went to the February 8 Vinalon Complex several times during when he saw lots of goods produced by the vinalon intermediate plants and made sure that a drastic turn was effected in the chemical industry of the country to spur the development of light industry.
					
					 On August 3 last year he looked round the exhibition hall of people's consumer goods of South Hamgyong Province where he indicated important tasks to serve as guidelines in conducting vigorous August 3 people's consumption goods production drive. This offered an important occasion of epochal significance in materializing the Workers' Party of Korea's grand strategy for improving the people's living standards.
					
					 Recently he gave field guidance to lots of light industrial plants including Pyongyang Textile Mill, Raknang Ponghwa Garment Factory, Ponghwa Soap Factory and Pyongyang Mechanical Pencil Factory, encouraging party members and other working people to the creation of a new surge advance speed for the improvement of the people's living standards.

articles.title: Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam by Slovak Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam by Slovak Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam,  president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Dusan Bella, Slovak ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 After receiving it, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Visits Granary Province to Learn about Farming
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Visits Granary Province to Learn about Farming
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim visited South Hwanghae Province from May 13 to 15 to learn about farming including rice transplantation.
					 He went round farms in several counties including Jaeryong, Kangryong, Yonan and Paechon and held consultative meetings at relevant units.
					
					 The importance of the province in attaining the goal of grain output for this year was stressed at the meetings and measures were taken for the Cabinet and relevant units to aid the farming in the province.
					
					 Earlier, Choe got familiarized himself with production and technological updating in major enterprises in Hamhung City.
					
					He went round the February 8 Vinalon Complex, Ryongsong Machine Complex and Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and made some economic organization to implement important tasks given by General Secretary Kim Jong Il during his field guidance.
					
					 Choe also made sure that measures were taken concerning technical matters after learning about the production at the Sunchon Cement Complex and the reclamation of Ryongmaedo Tideland.

articles.title: Talks between SPA Vice-Chairwoman and Secretary-General of IPU Held
articles.content:
Talks between SPA Vice-Chairwoman and Secretary-General of IPU Held
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Anders Johnsson, secretary-general of the Inter-Parliamentary Union, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present there was officials concerned.
					
					 At the talks, both sides exchanged views on developing the cooperative relations between the SPA and the IPU and a series of matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Friendship Visiting Group of DPRK Leaves for China
articles.content:
Friendship Visiting Group of DPRK Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A friendship visiting group of the DPRK led by Ri Kon Ho, deputy director general of the State General Bureau of Tourism, left here Tuesday to visit China.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference led by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The delegation made bows in deep reverence to the President who made undying contribution to the development of DPRK-China friendship and global independence.
					
					 Chen made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Visits Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Visits Friendship Tower
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference led by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower on Tuesday. 
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Wan Su, director of the Secretariat of the C.C., the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, officials concerned and Li Qingjiang, charge d'affaires a.i., and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who fought bravely on the Korean front, and then looked round the tower.
					
					 Chen made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Meeting Marks Anniversary of Work of Kim Il Sung and Historic Letter of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Meeting Marks Anniversary of Work of Kim Il Sung and Historic Letter of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday to mark the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Giving Definite Precedence to Geological Prospecting" and the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's letter "Let Us Bring about a Fresh Turn in Geological Prospecting".
					 The President made public the work at the national consultative meeting of officials in the field of geological prospecting on May 15, Juche 50 (1961) in which he advanced principled matters and tasks for pushing the geological prospecting ahead of economic development.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his letter to the participants in the national meeting of officials in the field of geological prospecting on May 25, Juche 80 (1991), clarified fundamental principles, key tasks and orientation and ways of prospecting including the issue of keeping geological prospecting ahead of mining industry and land administration and concentrating the prospecting force on key projects.
					
					 Attending the meeting were Premier Choe Yong Rim, Vice-Premier Jon Ha Chol, officials of ministries and national institutions, officials concerned, officials in the field of geological prospecting across the country and working people.
					
					 Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier and chairman of the State Planning Commission, in a report said that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il set forth tasks for the field and ways of carrying them out and has wisely led the work to implement them.
					
					 The President saw to it that the "DPRK Law on Underground Resources" was adopted which took great significance in providing legal and institutional guarantee for strengthening the geological prospecting, he said.
					
					 He referred to the shining achievements made in the field under the wise guidance of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All the successes gained in the past are a shining fruition of the wise guidance provided by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who indicated the path to be followed by the field of geological prospecting and provided guidance, he added.
					
					 He called on all officials and members of the prospecting corps to explore more underground resources and give rise to the honor of victors in the general advance for the improvement of the people's living standards and the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent Observed
articles.content:
World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent Observed
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- An event introducing Red Cross activities was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday to mark World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent under the co-sponsorship of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK and the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross active in the DPRK.
					 Attending it were officials of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK and officials concerned and members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and staff members of various embassies and those of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Activities of the said organizations were introduced at the event.

articles.title: National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children Opens
articles.content:
National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children Opens
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The 37th National Sports Contest of School Youth and Children for Jongilbong Prize was opened in the DPRK. 
					 More than 500 school youth and children selected from every province of the country are to take part in the contest divided into sections of secondary and primary schools. They will compete in 30 odd events including basketball, volleyball, table tennis and Taekwon-Do. 
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned and school youth and children. 
					
					 Ham Kwang Chol, secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made an opening address.

articles.title: Degree of DPRK Honorary Doctor of Forestry Conferred on Foreigner
articles.content:
Degree of DPRK Honorary Doctor of Forestry Conferred on Foreigner 
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- An honorary doctor's degree of the DPRK was conferred on Professor and Director Xu Jianchu, China and East Asia node representative of the World Agroforestry Center.
					 He contributed to the study, development and dissemination of the ways of combined management of forestry and agriculture and to the training of reserve scientists.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Vol. 93 Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Vol. 93 Off Press
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 93 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively deals with his works in a chronological order. 
					 The book contains 35 works including historic speeches, conclusions and talks made by President Kim Il Sung from January to July, Juche 82 (1993).
					
					"Young People Must Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Upholding the Leadership of the Party" reflects the noble intention of the President to make sure that the young people successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, single-mindedly united around General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 "Talks with Officials Looking round the Korean Revolution Museum" and "Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower Is Open-air Museum Showing Feats of Heroic Soldiers" and other works indicate the ways of arming the party members and other working people with the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu and socialist patriotism.
					
					 The book contains a work clarifying ideas and theories to serve as guidelines for accelerating the socialist economic construction as required by the developing reality and works dealing with the issues of improving and strengthening the work in the fields of education, literature and arts, successfully unearthing, preserving and managing historic relics and providing the people with good conditions for cultural recreation.
					
					 It also contains a work which clarifies the idea of calling upon all Koreans to achieve great unity for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and comprehensively indicates the general purpose of the great national unity of the nation and its ideological basis and principles and ways for achieving it.
					
					 It has works giving perfect answers to the theoretical and practical issues arising in strengthening the overseas compatriots' movement, the non-aligned movement and the international solidarity with the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Greening Projects
articles.content:
Greening Projects 
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- New greening projects have moved ahead in the DPRK. 
					Programs for greening of cities have been renewed.
					
					 All cities have held prize contests of greening layouts suitable for their geographical features.
					
					 They have also expanded the production capacity of tree and flower nurseries and greenhouses and built seed farms.
					
					 Greening experts are trained by Pyongyang University of Construction and Building-Materials Industry and universities of agriculture.

articles.title: Kamsalgu Tree Propagated
articles.content:
Kamsalgu Tree Propagated
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kamsalgu (persimmon-apricot) tree has been multiplied throughout the DPRK.
					 Ten years ago, the tree could be seen only in gardens of some farmhouses in Sinphyong County, North Hwanghae Province. 
					
					 According to data available, 120,000 trees of the species are now growing in many areas of the country.
					
					 Two or three years after planting, the fragrant tree begins to bear flowers and fruits.  
					
					 Each fruit is 60-100 grams in weight and 11.8 percent in sugar amount.  
					
					 The high-yield tree is strong in resistance to epidemics and cold. 
					
					 The tree was named kamsalgu by President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Three Books on Koryo Medicine
articles.content:
Three Books on Koryo Medicine
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Among the valuable heritages of the Korean nation are three medical books -- Hyangyakjipsongbang, Uibangryuchwi and Tonguibogam.
					 85-volume Hyangyakjipsongbang, compiled and published in three years from 1431, contains Koryo medical therapies and folk remedies.
					
					It introduces over 10,700 kinds of prescriptions for 959 kinds of diseases, 1 476 methods of acupuncture and moxibustion, many medicinal plants and their growing places, specific features and effects, and ways of their collection and use.
					
					 365-volume Uibangryuchwi was complied in 1445 and printed by mental type in 1477.
					
					 The book covers all medical achievements made in the East, including Korea, until the early 15th century, with diseases divided into 90 categories.  It gives details of morals and ethics in medical activities, principles of treatment, physiology of human body, origin and cause of diseases and clinical medicine.
					
					 Tonguibogam was compiled by Ho Jun, who was renowned as a medical man in his twenties. Falling into five divisions, it features dissection and physiology of human body, and examination, prevention and treatment methods of all diseases.
					
					 The book made a big contribution to developing the traditional Korean medicine.
					
					 It was published in 1613.

articles.title: Advanced Technologies Applied to Agricultural Production
articles.content:
Advanced Technologies Applied to Agricultural Production
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Agricultural Information and Technology Center under the Academy of the Agricultural Science has applied a geographical information system and a crop growth forecasting technology to agricultural production.
					 The center has achieved successes in researches for putting on a scientific basis all farm work, including selection of crops and soil, rice-planting, manuring and harvesting.  
					
					 Its scientists, in cooperation with the Ministry of Agriculture and the Hydro-meteorological Service, made a survey of farming and weather conditions over the past three decades and built a database necessary for ensuring stable crop yields in intermediary and mountainous areas.
					
					 They also developed software for forecasting crop growth.
					
					 The system based on the software is also applicable to fruit, vegetable and industrial crops farming and sericulture.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Line of National Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Line of National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation's movement for the country's reunification is a patriotic movement to be proud of as it has advanced and emerged victorious thanks to the distinguished idea and leadership of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung took a step to form the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea to energetically organize and mobilize all the Korean patriotic forces for the struggle for national unity and the country's reunification. 
					
					 In the subsequent period he adhered to the line of reunification-- the line of one Korea. On this basis he advanced reasonable proposals for reunification in every period and indicated overall orientations and ways to realize them. 
					
					 Under the outstanding leadership of Kim Il Sung, the committee has made a dynamic drive for providing a solid foundation for independent reunification, promoting national reconciliation and unity and developing the north-south dialogue and cooperation true to the Workers' Party of Korea's line and policy of national reunification since the declaration of its birth. It has thus made a great contribution to developing the movement for national reunification. 
					
					 The successes made by the committee in its activities are a striking demonstration of the validity and vitality of the party's line and policy of national reunification. 
					
					 The cause of the country's reunification started and led by Kim Il Sung is making a triumphant advance thanks to Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 All the Korean people are now making a dynamic patriotic struggle to achieve the national unity and the country's peace and reunification by their concerted efforts true to Kim Il Sung's line and policy of the country's reunification under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 At present the driving force for national reunification is growing stronger in the north, the south and abroad and getting united closer. They are dynamically advancing towards the country's independent and peaceful reunification, meeting the challenges of the separatist forces inside and outside Korea. 
					
					 The Korean nation's cause of the country's reunification is sure to triumph thanks to Kim Il Sung's line and policy of national reunification and Kim Jong Il's distinguished and seasoned leadership.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Confab for War of Aggression against DPRK Slashed
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Confab for War of Aggression against DPRK Slashed 
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- There took place in south Korea some time ago a "meeting of leading commanders of the armed forces" with the puppet minister of National Defense, the chairman of the joint chiefs of staff, chiefs of the general staff of the three services and brass hats of the military of above army corps commanders attending. The puppet defense chief at the "meeting" cried out for channeling all efforts into "training battle-ready troops," talking about "a military posture" to cope with someone's "military movement."
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said "meeting" of the puppet forces was another dangerous war huddle aimed at escalating the moves for a war against the DPRK under the pretext of "threat" from someone.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that traitor Lee Myung Bak when being briefed on the "meeting" openly called the "north the enemy of south Korea" and ordered the brass hats to "keep themselves fully ready to go into action."
					
					 This clearly indicates who is chiefly to blame for the evermore reckless anti-north war hysteria of the south Korean war maniacs.
					
					 The groundless accusations made by the puppet military group against the DPRK under the pretext of "existing threat" only bring to light their sinister intention to shift the blame for the escalating tension and the deteriorated north-south relations on to the DPRK and justify its moves for a war and thus realize its ambition for invading it at any cost. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persistently pursue a war, the army and people of the DPRK will deal deadly blows at the aggressors.
					
					 The south Korean warlike forces should properly understand the revolutionary will of the people in the DPRK and stop at once the reckless war rackets.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses US of Bringing Submarine to S. Korea
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses US of Bringing Submarine to S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. nuclear-powered submarine Michigan entered the Pusan base of south Korea some days ago. It is reported that Michigan, Ohio-class submarine of the U.S. Seventh Fleet, has more than a hundred Tomahawk missiles aboard. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The port-call made by the submarine at a time when a tense situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula indicates that the U.S. warlike forces have entered into a full-fledged phase of implementing their scenario for igniting another war of aggression against the DPRK. 
					
					 It is the intention of the U.S. to militarily stifle the DPRK and establish its military domination over the whole of Asia with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard. 
					
					 Michigan's port-call is aimed to mount a surprise and preemptive attack on the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S., however, claims that the port-call of the above-said submarine is nothing but a regular one in a bid to mislead the public opinion. 
					
					 Just as a gimlet in the bulging bag is bound to protrude, the evermore undisguised the war moves of the U.S. against the DPRK more saliently reveal its true colors as a disturber of peace and stability on the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korea: Repression of "Hanchongryon"
articles.content:
S. Korea: Repression of "Hanchongryon"
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Uijongbu District Court of south Korea on May 13 gave the verdict of guilty to a former member of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, who was prosecuted for violation of the "National Security Law", according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 This member was active as a policy maker of the 13th-term "Hanchongryon."
					
					 The puppet court sentenced the person to one year in jail, charging that an article and a song this member posted on "Hanchongryon" homepage were "enemy-benefiting."

articles.title: Police Suppression of Progressive Forces Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police Suppression of Progressive Forces Flayed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an Internet broadcasting service of south Korea, on May 13 carried an article condemning the puppet police for its fascist suppression of the progressive forces.
					 The article noted that the police searched houses of four members of the Association of Workers for Democracy on charges of violation of the "Security Law" that day.
					
					 The police did such outrage after charging that the association's program is similar to the DPRK's and the four members took part in an illegal rally, it said.
					
					 The present oppression campaign by the police aims at creating repressive atmosphere in the end, it said.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Searches House of Member of Opposition Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Searches House of Member of Opposition Organization
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The security investigation group of the south Korean puppet Seoul District Police Agency on May 12 searched the house of a member of the "People's Order", an organization for the unity of opposition forces.
					 The fascist police confiscated documents on the organization after searching the house in Kyonggi Province on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law" for the mere reason that he was active at the "Council for Promoting Reunification of Our Nation by Federal Formula" and re-posted on other homepage the contents of the north publication's article which had been posted on an Internet site.

articles.title: Sultan of Oman on Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Sultan of Oman on Development of Relations with DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The government of Oman will strive for development of the relations with the DPRK, said Sultan of Oman Qaboos Bin Said on May 8 when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Ri Hyok Chol.

articles.title: Decision of IIJI Meeting Supported in Pakistan
articles.content:
Decision of IIJI Meeting Supported in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Pakistan on May 9 to support the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI).
					 Present there were personages and members of Juche idea study organizations of Pakistan, including the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance and the Karachi Juche Study Center, and the director of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 The decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the IIJI Board of Directors was read out and speeches made at the meeting.
					
					 Speakers expressed full support for the decision, referring to the significance of commemoration of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They vowed to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.
					
					 An appeal to the Juche idea study organizations the world over was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The appeal stressed that Kim Il Sung, who founded the immortal Juche idea to clearly indicate the way for carving out the destiny of the popular masses, is always alive in the hearts of mankind.
					
					 It called upon the Juche idea study organizations to hold colorful political and cultural events in praise of the undying feats of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and conduct the brisk work to publish booklets carrying their works, pamphlets, magazines, etc., thus significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun and February holiday in 2012.

articles.title: Radiation Gets Evermore Serious in Japan
articles.content:
Radiation Gets Evermore Serious in Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Accidents are taking place one after another at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan, deepening the radiation crisis as the days go by. 
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. has so far injected cooling water into the pressure vessel, claiming that only a small amount of nuclear fuel melted in Rector No. 1 but its core remained undamaged.
					
					 But it was confirmed on May 12 that the meltdown of the core was occurring in the reactor contrary to the assertion of the company side. 
					
					 As regards this matter, an advisor to the prime minister said at a press conference that he did not imagine all parts of the core would melt down. 
					
					  TEPCO said that it would take quite a long time to take nuclear fuel out of the reactor now that the core was confirmed to be melting in the reactor, expressing the view that the recovery work would assume protracted nature even after the reactor has been stabilized and cooled. 
					
					 And the massive leakage of the water injected into the reactor to cool nuclear fuel poses a serious problem.
					
					 NHK in a report that there was a lot of water in the basement of the building that houses Reactor No.1 said that TEPCO was of the view that that was the water contaminated by radiation of very high concentration which leaked through the hole in the pressure vessel. 
					
					It was confirmed that the level of radiation measured in the area southeast of the building of the reactor reached 2,000 millisieverts per hour at maximum.
					
					 At a time when the damage by radiation is expanding, the Tokyo Shimbun on Sunday said that one member of the group engaged in the recovery work died.
					
					 Meanwhile, radioactive cesium higher than the legal level was detected on freshwater fish caught in Iwaki City and Kitashiobara Son. 
					
					  Contaminated fish was also found in waters off Iwaki City.

articles.title: Many Japanese Businesses Go Bankrupt
articles.content:
Many Japanese Businesses Go Bankrupt 
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Japanese businesses are going bankrupt like flies due to the ceaseless economic stagnation.
					The number of corporate bankruptcies in Japan in April reached 1,076, according to Tokyo Shoko Research on May 12.
					
					 The debts left by the failed firms rose to 279.57 billion yen.

articles.title: Heavy Rains Pounce Guizhou Province, China
articles.content:
Heavy Rains Pounce Guizhou Province, China
 Beijing, May 15 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains fell in Guizhou Province, China, for recent consecutive days, causing damage.
					 According to the Civil Affairs Agency of the province, three causalities were registered and at least 3,900 people urgently evacuated as of May 12.
					
					 129 dwelling houses were pulled down and crops on 7,578 hectares of fields damaged.
					
					 The total number of victims is 334,800.
					
					 The province is taking steps to eradicate the aftermath of the heavy rains.

articles.title: Iran to Send Satellites into Space
articles.content:
Iran to Send Satellites into Space 
 Tehran, May 15 (KCNA) -- Iran would send the Fajr (Dawn) satellite into space by September, while the Tolou (Sunrise) satellite would be launched in February 2012.
					 The preparations for their launches are progressing apace.
					
					 The satellites would capture images with a resolution of 50 meters and then transmit them to stations on earth.
					
					 This was reported by a TV radio of Iran recently.

articles.title: Angola's Measures to Modernize Agriculture
articles.content:
Angola's Measures to Modernize Agriculture
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Angola is paying attention to modernizing the agricultural field.
					 The minister of Agriculture, Rural Development and Fishery of Angola at a recent meeting referred to the steps taken by the government to modernize agriculture.
					
					 The government will increase investment in the agricultural field, ensure close cooperation with different fields and exchange experience gained in modernizing the agricultural field through multifarious exchange with other countries, he noted.
					
					 It will expand crop cultivation areas and boost the agricultural production, he added.

articles.title: US Beefs up Its Naval Force
articles.content:
US Beefs up Its Naval Force
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is putting spurs to the moves for increasing the naval force in a bid to intensify aggression and military intervention in other countries.
					 "George H. W. Bush", Nimitz-class nuclear carrier, was formally commissioned on May 12.
					
					 It will belong to the U.S. Fifth Fleet in charge of the Persian Gulfs and the Arabian Sea.
					
					 It is reported that this brought the total number of the U.S. Navy aircraft carriers in operation to 11.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envía telegramas de respuesta a líderes extranjeros
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envía telegramas de respuesta a líderes extranjeros
						
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envió telegramas de respuesta a los jefes de partido y Estado de varios países quienes le remitieron los mensajes con motivo del día de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Los destinatarios son Michel Suleiman, presidente de la República del Líbano, Bashar Al-Assad, secretario regional del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Árabe (BAAS) y presidente de la República Árabe de Siria, Norodom Sihamoni, rey de Cambodia, Asif Ali Zardari, presidente de la República Islámica de Pakistán, Mwai Kibaki, presidente de la República de Kenia, Joseph Kabila Kabange, presidente de la República Democrática de Congo, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, presidente de la República de Uganda y Syed Yousaf Raza Gillani, premier de la República de Pakistán.
					
					El Dirigente expresó en las misivas su convicción de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperación entre Corea y los países de destinatarios se ampliarán y se desarrollarán en diferentes esferas, y les deseó éxitos en sus trabajos para la paz, la estabilidad y la prosperidad del país.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe telegramas provenientes de varios países
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe telegramas provenientes de varios países
						
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibió telegramas que le dirigieran las entidades y personalidades de varios países con motivo del cumpleaños (15 de abril) del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Entre los remitentes figuran el Comité Central del Partido de Pueblo de Camboya, el CC del Partido Comunista de la India (Marxista), el secretario general del CC del Partido Comunista Nepalés (Marxista-Leninista), el secretario general de la Organización Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia, el secretario general del CC del Partido Comunista de Bangladesh, el secretario general del Frente Democrático por la Liberación de Palestina, el presidente del Consejo Central del Partido Político Republicano Unidad Popular-"Kirguiz El" de Kirguizistán, el presidente del Partido Comunista de Tadjikistán, el presidente general y el secretario general del Consejo de Dirección Central del Partido Vanguardista de Indonesia, el presidente y el primer secretario del CC del Partido Comunista de Noruega, el presidente de la Dirección Nacional del Partido Comunista de Dinamarca (Marxista-Leninista), el presidente del Partido Comunista de Alemania, el presidente del Consejo Supremo del Partido Socialista de Rumania, la presidenta del Partido por la Paz y la Unidad de Rusia, el presidente del Partido de los Trabajadores Comunistas de Hungría, el presidente honorario de la Unión de Comunistas Búlgaros, el presidente del Partido Comunista de Suecia, el secretario general del CC del Partido Comunista de Checoslovaquia, el presidente del CC del Partido Comunista de Cechy-Morava, el presidente del Partido Obrero Comunista de Finlandia para la Paz y el Socialismo, el presidente del Comité Ejecutivo Nacional del Partido Comunista de Polonia, el secretario general del Partido Comunista de Nueva Yugoslavia, el presidente, el vicepresidente y secretario internacional y el secretario general del Partido Comunista de Gran Bretaña (Marxista-Leninista), el secretario general del Partido Comunista Unido de Italia, el secretario general del Partido Comunista del Congo Democrático, el secretario general del Partido Nacional Progresista Unido de Egipto, el presidente del CC del Partido Socialista de México, el presidente nacional y el secretario internacional del CC del Partido Comunista Brasileño, el presidente nacional del Partido de Patria Libre de Brasil, el líder nacional del CC del Partido Comunista de Canadá (Marxista-Leninista), el presidente, el secretario general y el secretario internacional del Partido Comunista del Perú Patria Roja, el secretario del Comité Ejecutivo Nacional del Partido Socialista-Frente Amplio del Ecuador, etc.
					
					  Igualmente, se encuentran las personalidades de alto rango de los círculos político, social, económico y militar de China, Rusia, Nepal, Malasia, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Siria, Camboya, Kuwait, Tailandia, Pakistán, Kazajstán, Kirguizistán, Turquía, Irán, Indonesia, la India, Japón, Yemen, Vietnam, Noruega, Dinamarca, Alemania, Rumania, Moldova, Bulgaria, Belarus, Suiza, Suecia, Checo, Francia, Finlandia, Polonia, Gran Bretaña, Austria, Ucrania, Islandia, Italia, Guinea, Nigeria, Sudáfrica, Malí, Benin, Congo Democrático, Túnez, Uganda, Egipto, Etiopia, México, Brasil, Venezuela, Canadá, Colombia, el Perú, Uruguay, el Ecuador, Nueva Zelanda.
					
					Lo hicieron también los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, las entidades estudiosas de la idea Juche y las partidarias de la reunificación de Corea y de amistad con el pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il visita cerca de 80 unidades desde diciembre de 2008
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il visita cerca de 80 unidades desde diciembre de 2008
						
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ATCC) -- El 24 de diciembre del 97 (2008) de la Era Juche, el Dirigente visitó el Complejo de Acero Chollima donde encendió la antorcha del nuevo auge revolucionario. 
					Desde entonces para acá, para preparar la era de prosperidad de la industria ligera, el Dirigente visitó cerca de 80 unidades con un promedio de más de 2 al mes. 
					
					Al dirigir sobre el terreno la Fábrica de Elaboración de Harina de Trigo de Pyongyang, la Fábrica de Elaboración de Alimentos de Hoeryong y otras muchas fábricas y unidades, enseñó que construyeran las fábricas en el máximo nivel de acuerdo con la demanda del nuevo siglo y de modo rentable para que el pueblo se beneficiara realmente. 
					
					En la Fábrica de Productos Especiales Samilpho, dijo que vio aquí la nueva simiente del desarrollo de la industria ligera e instruyó avivarla como antorcha que cubra todo el país. 
					
					En el distrito de Changsong, apreció altamente los éxitos logrados en una pequeña fábrica alimentaria de esta zona montañosa y dio la orientación de registrar un nuevo cambio en el desarrollo de industria local siguiendo el ejemplo de ella.
					
					Visitó de orientación muchas unidades de diferentes sectores desde las fábricas claves hasta las cooperativas de producción locales, de modo que se levantara en todo el país una fuerte oleada del desarrollo de industria ligera. 
					
					En estos días, estuvo en la Fábrica Textil de Pyongyang, la Fábrica de Confecciones Ponghwa de Rangnang, la Fábrica de Jabón Ponghwa, la Fábrica de Portaminas de Pyongyang y otras muchas fábricas de la rama, llamando a los militantes del partido y otros trabajadores a la creación de la nueva velocidad en la marcha por el gran auge hacia el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador eslovaco
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador eslovaco 
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, recibió el día 17 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las cartas credenciales de Dusan Bella, nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la República de Eslovaquia en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, el presidente departió con el diplomático.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
						
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ATCC) -- El premier Choe Yong Rim averiguó cómo marchan las faenas agrícolas de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, donde comenzó el transplante de las posturas de arroz, recorriéndola del día 13 al 15.
					Él estuvo en las granjas de varios distritos de la provincia, inclusive Jaeryong, Kangryong, Yonan y Paechon, y convocó en ellas las reuniones consultivas.
					
					En las ocasiones se dio énfasis en la importancia de la misión que asume la provincia en alcanzar la meta de producción de cereales de este año y se tomaron las medidas para exigir a las unidades relacionadas, sobre todo, el Consejo de Ministros, apoyar activamente la agricultura de la provincia.
					
					Anteriormente, el premier se enteró del estado de producción y modernización tecnológica de las empresas importantes de la ciudad de Hamhung.
					
					Tras visitar el Complejo de Vinalón 8 de Febrero, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong y el Complejo de Abonos de Hungnam y organizó las gestiones económicas para cumplir cabalmente las tareas programáticas asignadas por el Dirigente    Kim Jong Il durante su orientación en el terreno.
					
					Por otra parte, atendió los problemas prácticos vinculados con la producción del Complejo de Cemento de Sunchon y con la roturación de marismas en la isla Ryongmae.
